data.text: The act or activity of one that reads.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The act or practice of rendering aloud written or printed matter.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An official or public recitation of written material.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: the reading of a will; a reading by the poet of her own works.

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The specific form of a particular passage in a text.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: a manuscript with a variant reading.

data.text: The distinctive interpretation of a work of performing art given by the person or persons performing it.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: He gave us his reading of the situation.

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: The survivors' account is fascinating reading.

data.text: The information indicated by a gauge or graduated instrument.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Inclined to read; having a taste for reading; of a studious disposition: as, a reading community.
